edu.ycp.cs201.cards

Class Pile

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ycp.cs201.cards.Pile

  • public class Pile
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent a pile of Cards. Each card has an index, with index 0 being the card at the bottom of the pile. Each pile has an "expose index": all cards whose indices are greater than or equal to the expose index are face-up, and all other cards are face-down.

      • Pile

        public Pile()
        Constructor. The pile will be empty initially, and its expose index will be set to 0.

        public void addCard(Card card)
        Add a Card to the pile. The card added is placed on top of the cards currently in the pile.
        Parameters:
        card - the Card to add

        Returns:
        the number of @{link Card}s in the pile

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the pile is empty, false otherwise

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int index)
        Get the Card whose index is given.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the card to get
        Returns:
        the Card at the index
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the index does not refer to a valid card

      • getIndexOfTopCard

        public int getIndexOfTopCard()
        Returns:
        the index of the top Card, or -1 if the pile is empty

      • removeCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> removeCards(int numCards)
        Remove given number of Cards from the top of the pile.
        Parameters:
        numCards - number of cards to remove
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing the removed cards
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pile does not have enough Cards to satisfy the request

      • addCards

        public void addCards(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsToAdd)
        Add Cards to the top of the pile.
        Parameters:
        cardsToAdd - an ArrayList containing the Cards to add

      • populate

        public void populate()
        Populate the pile by adding 52 Cards representing all possible combinations of Suit and Rank.

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Shuffle the Cards in the pile by rearranging them randomly.

        Remove the top Card on the pile and return it.

        Throws:
